item.title: 8 Best Open-World Games That Don't Overstay Their Welcome, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Some open-world games are short, sweet, and worth playing, like A Short Hike, providing a charming experience in under two hours.
  • Games like Deus Ex: Mankind Divided may overstay their welcome with forced microtransactions, while titles like Sleeping Dogs offer compelling stories.
  • Longer games like Marvel's Spider-Man 2 and Grand Theft Auto 5 keep players engaged with exciting set pieces, but may stretch the narrative thin.

Open-world games are all the rage in modern times, with fans being bombarded with so many entries in this genre that it can make their head spin. As a result, players who have limited time on their hands may not appreciate having to invest so much time into a massive sandbox that might not even be worthwhile.

After all, players don't want to be burned out by a game after seeing all the tricks up its sleeve. This is why open-world games that take players on a rollercoaster ride and don't cause any fatigue are always welcome. These are some games that don't become a slog to get through.

8 A Short Hike

A Refreshingly Short & Simple Open-World Game

A Short Hike
7.0 /10
Released
April 5, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
E For Everyone
Powered by

Given that A Short Hike barely takes an hour or two to complete, it's easy to see why this is the perfect game for fans with a little less spare time. It's a bite-sized chunk of charming visuals and entertaining interactions, as players control an anthropomorphic bird who struggles to reach the top of a mountain to get cellphone reception.

This simple premise is perfect for a short and sweet open-world game. Players collect golden feathers to improve their climbing and flying skills, helping them reach the summit and complete this charming indie title.

7 Deus Ex: Mankind Divided

If Anything, The Game Understays Its Welcome

Deus Ex: Mankind Divided
9 /10
8.0 /10
Released
August 23, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL
9 /10
8.0 /10

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood, Drug Reference, Intense Violence, Partial Nudity, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, Use of Alcohol
Powered by

It's a shame that Square Enix Europe was so incompetent about handling its IPs. Deus Ex: Mankind Divided could have been a worthy sequel to Human Revolution , but forcing the developers to add in-game microtransactions and release the game before their overall scope was realized left players hanging when the going was getting good.

The small open-world hub of Prague is one of the most immaculately designed locations in an immersive sim, and it deserves better. Mankind Divided is a decently long game, so it speaks volumes about its quality that fans wanted the experience to stretch on for way longer than the point where the story unceremoniously drew to a close.

6 Sleeping Dogs

Amazing Combat, Striking Visuals, & A Compelling Story

Sleeping Dogs
9 /10
10
8.3 /10
Released
August 14, 2012

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL
9 /10
10
8.3 /10

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Sexual Content, Strong Language, Use of Drugs
Powered by

Sleeping Dogs is one of the most underrated open-world games, and more people need to check it out. The adventures of undercover cop Wei Shen in Hong Kong are more riveting than they have any right to be, courtesy of a fun combat system, gorgeous world, and riveting story.

Even the lackluster shooting and dated driving feel great, since elements of Hong Kong thriller flicks are abundant here. Smashing an enemy's face using a variety of environmental takedowns is the closest fans will get to enjoying a Yakuza -esque game by Western developers.

5 Marvel's Spider-Man 2

Could Have Been Longer & More Fleshed-Out

8 Images
8 Images
Marvel's Spider-Man 2
9 /10
48
8.9 /10
Released
October 20, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL
9 /10
48
8.9 /10

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Blood, Drug Reference, Mild Language, Violence
Powered by

Marvel's Spider-Man 2 is a jam-packed rollercoaster ride that never lets up. Even if the narrative may not be as tight as the first game, the amazing set pieces and improved combat make up for these issues.

As astounding as the game is, some people feel that the latter half of the title feels rushed. New York's infected state could have served as the backdrop for numerous missions in the same vein as Web of Shadows , but it just served as an altered world state for a few missions before things went back to normal.

4 Bully

Bullworth Academy & Its Surroundings Are A Treat To Explore

Bully
9.2 /10
Released
October 17, 2006

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen due to Crude Humor, Language, Sexual Themes, Use of Alcohol and Tobacco, Violence
Powered by

From the moment players take their first steps into Bullworth Academy, they'll realize how unique Bully is. Jimmy Hopkins' adventures feature unique combat tools and a ton of truancy as he strives to take revenge for the actions of a fellow classmate.

Players will fall in love with Bullworth Academy and appreciate that the game lets players explore the town of this region, too. By the time Jimmy finally gives Gary the beatdown he deserves, players will hate to pry themselves away from one of Rockstar's greatest games, one that is in dire need of a sequel.

3 Grand Theft Auto 5

Despite The Massive World, Players Can Power Through The Story In No Time

5 Images
5 Images
Grand Theft Auto 5
9 /10
134
8.9 /10
Released
September 17, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL
9 /10
134
8.9 /10

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Mature Humor, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content, Use of Drugs and Alcohol
Powered by

For a game as massive as Grand Theft Auto 5 , fans wondered if they would be burned out after a point. This is nowhere near the case, since Los Santos and the countryside are full of so many things to do that fans will never get bored.

Even if the convenience in the game's writing is a bit too apparent, the set pieces are so memorable that fans lament the fact that there aren't more Heist missions in the single-player mode. The main campaign isn't the longest, so it's possible that players wouldn't want to give up on this world even after the main trio gets a payout for the ages.

2 Batman: Arkham City

An Immaculately-Paced Open-World Game

Batman Arkham City
9 /10
18
9.4 /10
Released
October 18, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL
9 /10
18
9.4 /10

ESRB
T for Teen: Alcohol Reference, Blood, Mild Language, Suggestive Themes, Use of Tobacco, Violence
Powered by

One of the many things praised about Arkham City was its amazing pace. Both the main and side content felt noteworthy, letting players interact with some of the Caped Crusader's most iconic villains.

The open world isn't overwhelmingly large like Arkham Knight. Instead, it feels just small enough for players to have a great time gliding and grappling across Arkham City. This sound structure, coupled with combat improvements, ensures that no one will feel bored while playing one of the greatest superhero games of all time.

1 Disco Elysium

The City Of Revachol Is Brimming With Details

Disco Elysium
9 /10
12
9.6 /10
Released
October 15, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL
9 /10
12
9.6 /10

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, Use of Drugs, Violence
Powered by

From the very moment players see their protagonist wake up after a bender so cataclysmic that they lost their memories, they know they're in for a wild ride with Disco Elysium . After exploring Whirling-In-Rags, players step into the city of Revachol and are wowed by what's on offer here.

Every corner hides everything from a neat secret to an interesting NPC with fun dialogue. The amazing narrative and unique RPG mechanics ensure that players will hate dropping this game after reaching the end of a riveting experience.

item.title: How To Get Voidfire Deathcycle in World of Warcraft
item.description:
The Horrific Vision of Orgrimmar and Storwmind were first added to World of Warcraft during the last major patch of Battle For Azeroth . Since the future of The War Within and the upcoming expansion, Midnight , appear to be very void-themed, Blizzard has released a revamped version of the Horrific Visions. While there have been few to no changes to this activity, there are plenty of rewards for players to obtain. This also includes some new mounts, like the purple version of the Hateforged Blazecycle. This new mount, the Voidfire Deathcycle, is not a random drop but is a secret that you can uncover.

How to Get the Voidfire Deathcycle in World of Warcraft

Before you can even obtain the Voidfire Deathcycle, you must first complete all objectives and then kill the boss in either Horrific Vision of Stormwind or Orgrimmar. Doing so will unlock one of the masks, which allows you to make the activity even more difficult. Once you have at least one mask unlocked, you will want to make sure you are wearing it before the start of Horrific Vision of Stormwind.

Both Stormwind and Orgrimmar are on a weekly rotation. So if Horrific Vision of Orgrimmar is active, you will have to wait till the next weekly reset.

Aside from making Horrific Visions more difficult and rewarding more Displaced Corrupted Mementos, there are certain things you can only see when you have one or more masks activated.

One example of this is the Voidfire Deathcycle, which shows up in the Dwarven District of Horrific Vision of Strowmind. You will find it near the auction house. Attack it until Haymar the Devout spawns. Kill him and then interact with the Voidfire Deathcycle. You will see a dialogue option that you can select. This will cause a ghostly version of the Voidfire Deathcycle to appear outside the entrance to Horrific Visions in Dornogal.

You will be able to interact with the bike and see some dialogue options about parts. In order to obtain the Voidfire Deathcycle mount, you must find all the parts within the Horrific Visions of Stormwind and Orgrimmar and also acquire some crafting materials.

Any progress you make toward building the Voidfire Deathcycle is warbound. So if you complete one part and insert it on one character, that progress you've made will apply to your entire account and you won't have to get that part again on a separate character. So, if you happen to have an Engineer alt, this will make your life much easier.

How to Get the Parts for the Voidfire Deathcycle

One of the first things you will want to do is craft or purchase the following materials. All materials need to be Rank Three quality:

  • 12 Entropy Enhancer
  • Five Weavercloth Spellthread
  • Three Whimisical Wiring
  • Refulgent Crystal
  • Storm-Touched Weapon Wrap
  • Convincingly Realistic Jumper Cables
  • Recalibrated Safety Switch
  • Irresistible Red Button


The trickiest of these materials is the Irresistible Red Button which is a bind-on-pickup item crafted by Engineers. If you are an Engineer, then you can just craft one provided your Khaz Algar Engineering is high enough and you have the parts. If you aren't an Engineer, it is a little more complicated.

If you don't want to spend the time leveling Engineering, learn Engineering on an alt but don't level it. Next to the portal to Azj-Kahet in Dornogal is a building with the Black Market Auction House. In this building, there will be an item you can loot if you are an Engineer that will give you all the Piles of Rusted Scrap that you need. This material is also bind-on-pickup, which is why you need Engineering for the next step.

Gather the other materials needed for the Irresistible Red Button (12 Handfuls of Bismuth Bolts, three Whimsical Wiring, four Gyrating Gears, and an Etropy Enhancer) and create a public Craft Order. Make sure to leave a good tip, as this will make it far more likely that another player will pick up your order and make it for you.

Vendors around Khaz Algar, like Apothecary Rz in City of Threads, will occasionally sell limited quantities of Piles of Rusted Scrap. It may take a few days to get all the materials needed, but this is another method for acquiring the Piles of Rusted Scrap needed to make the Irresistible Red Button.

In addition to the items above, you must also obtain some old materials from Wrath of the Lich King , which are sold by Roxi Ramrocket in K3, Storm Peaks. Purchase the following from her:

  • Elementium-Plated Exhaust Pipe
  • Four Goblin-Machined Pistons

These materials can only be purchased, and will set you back 5,500 gold. Fortunately, it is easier to get gold now than it was in Wrath of the Lich King or earlier, so you should have no trouble getting the amount of gold needed if you don't already have it.

Materials From Horrific Visions of Stormwind and Orgrimmar

In addition to the extensive shopping list above, you will need to gather some items from within both the Horrific Visions of Orgrimmar and Stormwind. Some can be found within the activity itself, while others only drop from chests at the end. Regardless, you will need to have at least one mask equipped to even obtain them.

Item

Where It Drops

Source

Twisted Skull-Scythe Handlebars

Horrific Vision of Stormwind

Complete Old Town with one mask equipped

Depleted Void Crystal

Horrific Vision of Stormwind

Complete Mage Quarter with one mask equipped

Voidflame-Resistant Hide

Both

Complete Dwarven District & Valley of Spirits with one mask equipped

Tentacle Spokes

Both

Complete the Trade District & The Drag with one mask equipped

Magic-Lined Manifold

Horrific Vision of Stormwind

Can be found outside the Auction House in Trade District

Void-Scarred Boarhide

Horrific Vision of Orgrimmar

Complete the Valley of Honor with one mask equipped

Void-Forged Engine Block

Horrific Vision of Orgrimmar

Can be found inside the Engineering shop in the Drag

When you've obtained all the parts above, you can combine them with the other materials. When examining the hologram of the Voidfire Deathcycle, you will be able to insert these items. Once you've done this for each part, the Voidfire Deathcycle will be added to your collection.

World of Warcraft
8 /10

WHERE TO PLAY

item.title: 8 Assassin's Creed Games With The Best Exploration, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Assassin's Creed games thrive on a combination of combat, exploration, and story to create an immersive experience.
  • Each game in the franchise offers a unique setting and experience, catering to different player preferences.
  • Despite some fatigue with the RPG formula, recent releases like Valhalla continue to engage fans with their open worlds.

Assassin's Creed is one of the most popular open-world franchises around that shows no signs of stopping anytime soon. Even with the recent fatigue that fans have experienced for this series, successful releases like Assassin's Creed Shadows prove that there's still a lot of steam in this IP.

The best games in the franchise combine combat, exploration, and story into one delectable cocktail that fans can easily get drunk on. A good open world is critical for an Assassin's Creed game, since players will be encouraged to explore the world and find secrets while testing out their parkour abilities if they vibe with the setting.

8 Assassin's Creed 3

The Frontier Is More Fun To Explore Than People Give It Credit For

6 Images
6 Images
Assassin's Creed III
8 /10
8.4 /10
Released
October 30, 2012

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL
8 /10
8.4 /10

Developer(s)
Ubisoft Montreal
Publisher(s)
Ubisoft
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, Nintendo Wii U, PC, PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Xbox 360, Stadia
Powered by

While Assassin's Creed may have enjoyed more of a mixed reception compared to the titles that preceded it, this title was a blast to play if the open world clicked with fans. The Frontier encouraged players to go on hunts and jump from tree to tree, making for a simple yet unique spin on the title's typically urban parkour gameplay.

Connor's adventures in Assassin's Creed 3 are great, and fans have warmed up to this title over time as the years have gone by. The open-world activities feel organic and do a great job of immersing players as they strive to find collectibles and acquire rare resources by exploring every nook and cranny of the Frontier.

7 Assassin's Creed 2

Despite Its Dated Nature, The Nostalgia Of Exploring Italy During The Renaissance Is Unmatched

Assassin's Creed 2
11
8.9 /10
Released
November 7, 2009

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Ubisoft
Publisher(s)
Ubisoft
Platform(s)
macOS, Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4, Xbox 360, Xbox One
Powered by

Ezio Auditore da Firenze is the greatest Assassin's Creed protagonist in the eyes of many. His charming and suave attitude takes a real hit after a major tragedy befalls his family, causing him to walk down the path of an Assassin to seek revenge.

There's no denying that Assassin's Creed 2 is pretty dated, but players who don't mind dealing with somewhat clunky controls will love what this title brings to the table. Exploring iconic locations like Venice and Florence during the Italian Renaissance feels great as players get a history lesson while getting invested in an amazing plot.

6 Assassin's Creed Valhalla

The RPG Formula Had Become Dated, But Valhalla Is Still Fun To Explore

Assassin's Creed Valhalla
9 /10
18
7.9 /10
Released
November 10, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL
9 /10
18
7.9 /10

Developer(s)
Ubisoft
Publisher(s)
Ubisoft
Platform(s)
Stadia, PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

The RPG approach to modern Assassin's Creed games felt like a breath of fresh air at first, only for fans to realize that this transition came at the cost of sacrificing some of the core elements of the series. This is why fans were a bit tired of this formula already by the time Valhalla came out.

A Viking Assassin's Creed game set in Anglo-Saxon England definitely made for some fun exploration, and fans loved how massive and jam-packed this world was. It reached a point where some people found the sandbox to be too massive for their liking, which was a complaint carried over from Odyssey .

5 Assassin's Creed Unity

The Painstakingly Detailed Recreation Of Paris Is Amazing

Assassin's Creed Unity
6 /10
7.9 /10
Released
November 11, 2014

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL
6 /10
7.9 /10

Developer(s)
Ubisoft
Publisher(s)
Ubisoft
Platform(s)
PS4, Xbox One, PC, Stadia
OpenCritic Rating
Fair
Powered by

Exploring a meticulously detailed version of Paris during the French Revolution made Assassin's Creed Unity extremely captivating. It's a shame that the title had such a broken launch, but the modern version of this game is pretty stable and well worth checking out.

Unity's improved climbing mechanics made it a ton of fun to explore this version of Paris, with players finding several side activities to spend their time on, too. The story may be somewhat weak for an Assassin's Creed game, but the exploration more than makes up for it.

4 Assassin's Creed Odyssey

A World So Massive That It Can Become Genuinely Overwhelming After A Point

Assassin's Creed Odyssey
15
8.7 /10
Released
October 15, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Ubisoft Quebec
Publisher(s)
Ubisoft
Platform(s)
PS4, Xbox One, Switch, PC, Stadia
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Odyssey is a massive video game that lets players explore Ancient Greece and find a ton of secrets and quests in the process. However, this approach also led to an open world that exhausted many fans.

As long as players balance exploration and the main story, they'll have a great time with Assassin's Creed Odyssey . The game is genuinely jam-packed with so much detail that it would be a shame for players not to appreciate these hand-crafted environments if they've been burnt out.

3 Assassin's Creed Syndicate

Victorian London Is One Of The Best Assassin's Creed Settings Of All Time

Assassin's Creed Syndicate
7.7 /10
Released
October 23, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Ubisoft
Publisher(s)
Ubisoft
Platform(s)
PS4, Xbox One, PC, Stadia, Amazon Luna
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Assassin's Creed Syndicate is one of the best video games in the series that unfairly suffered in sales after Unity 's poor launch alienated many fans. It's a shame, since the adventures of the Frye twins as they strive to liberate Victorian England and spark a revolution are a blast.

It helped that this open world is jaw-droppingly gorgeous and packed with immense detail. Even the mixed reception to the grappling hook didn't stop players from enjoying the sights.

2 Assassin's Creed Origins

Players Were In Awe Of How Massive And Stunning The Game Was

Assassin's Creed Origins
8.6 /10
Released
October 27, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Ubisoft
Publisher(s)
Ubisoft
Platform(s)
Xbox One, PC, PlayStation 4, Stadia
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

With Assassin's Creed taking a yearly hiatus for the first time in a while, fans wondered what Origins would turn out to be. The game clearly took inspiration from The Witcher 3 with its RPG influences, and this isn't a bad thing in the slightest.

Assassin's Creed RPGs may seem somewhat tiresome now, but the setting of Egypt was so massive and beautiful that many fans touted this game as a return to form for the franchise. Bayek's exploration takes him to several unique locations full of meaningful rewards and interesting lore to uncover.

1 Assassin's Creed 4: Black Flag

Sailing In The Caribbean Is A Huge Part Of What Makes This Game So Special

Assassin's Creed 4: Black Flag
10.0 /10
Released
October 29, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Ubisoft Montreal
Publisher(s)
Ubisoft
Platform(s)
PC, Xbox 360, Xbox One, Nintendo Wii U, Nintendo Switch, PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

To this day, there's something special about exploring the Caribbean as a pirate that makes Black Flag the best game in the series. Edward Kenway assumes the role of an Assassin who enjoys the life of piracy and explores many unique locations.

Whaling, finding undiscovered islands, and sailing from one spot to the next are all surprisingly engaging. The game's high-seas exploration plays a huge role in making Black Flag 's setting iconic, to the point where some people hail this world as the best ever to feature in an Assassin's Creed game.

item.title: Grow a Garden: Best Pets Tier List
item.description:
With Roblox's Grow a Garden animal update, the devs have really stepped up the game by adding a ton of fun new content. Now, besides growing fruits and taking care of your garden, you can also have some pets, just like Pet Simulator 99 . These animals aren't just a cute addition to your farm; they also boost your crops and improve your player experience in some pretty cool ways.

Some pets will make your fruits and veggies mutate, while others will make them bigger or even give you free fruits and seeds. To get them, though, youll need to buy and hatch their eggs, which can cost a lot of Sheckles. So, its important to know which animals are worth it. If youre looking to spend wisely, this guide ranks the animals from least to most valuable in Grow a Garden .

Updated by Somiya Adrees on May 29, 2025: Pets are undoubtedly a fantastic feature of GaG. They lend a friendly hand in daily in-game tasks. The tier list below has been refreshed to include every pet available up to the 1.07.0 update, covering all animals regardless of their exclusivity. This is to give players a comprehensive view of all pets so they can decide which ones to keep, trade, or let go.

Grow a Garden All Pets Tier List

Currently, Grow a Garden is home to 42 animals , each with its own unique abilities. Think of them as walking gear they can do stuff like turn your crops into unique variants (i.e., Gold, Shocked, Chilled, or Rainbow), water your plants, speed up sprinklers, or even search out free seeds for you.

You can only have three animals active in your garden at a time (unless you've snagged more pet slots), but the good news is that any extras you hatch wont go to waste. You can swap them in and out whenever you like for a fresh vibe or to enjoy their different perks. Heres a simple tier list of all the animals in Grow a Garden , with reasons why some are more useful than others:

All Animals

Tier List

Reasoning

Dragonfly

S Tier

Gives you a Gold plant every five minutes (worth 20x more) hard to say no to that.

Polar Bear

S Tier

Might give you a Chilled (2x value) or Frozen fruit (10x value).

Praying Mantis

S Tier

Mutations make crops more valuable definitely a must-have.

Red Giant Ant

S Tier

Can copy your plants when you pick them even Divine ones.

Pig

S Tier

Grants mutations to your crops, so its a good pick.

Golden Lab

S Tier

Digs up random seeds (Common to Divine) perfect for farming while you're AFK.

Raccoon

S Tier

Gives free fruit every 15 minutes by cloning one from a neighbors garden.

Mole

S Tier

Can dig up free gear for you (i.e., Sprinklers, Lightning Rod, Night Staff) and also Sheckles.

Brown Mouse

S Tier

Perfect for unlocking more pet slots since it ages fast (750 EXP/10 min) and also boosts player jump height.

Red Fox

S Tier

Steals (duplicates) a plant seed from a neighbors farm (Seed Shop plants only).

Blood Owl

S Tier

Makes all your active pets age faster.

Chicken Zombie

S Tier

Grants your fruits the Zombified Mutation (25x multiplier).

Firefly

S Tier

Turns your crops Shocked (50x multiplier).

Moon Cat

A Tier

Boosts fruit size (1.51x) and keeps Lunar and Blood Moon plants from disappearing after harvest (with only a 6.1% chance).

Caterpillar

A Tier

Makes leafy plants grow faster (Beanstalk, Corn, Pepper, Eggplant, etc.), but there are other crops that arent leafy.

Panda

A Tier

Bamboo is a solid money plant, and Panda boosts it even more. If you dont have Bamboo, though, its not as useful.

Snail

A Tier

Can sometimes give you a seed from the plant you just harvested.

Silver Monkey

A Tier

When you sell fruit, it might pop back into your inventory even mutated ones like Shocked, Gold, or Rainbow. The rarer it is, the lower the chance.

Echo Frog

A Tier

Ideal for fruit growth, it speeds up a random plants fruit by a full day every 10 minutes.

Orange Tabby

A Tier

Makes crops 1.5x bigger in size and weight, which boosts their value.

Blood Hedgehog

A Tier

Its best if you have lots of prickly fruits (i.e., Durian, Cactus, Dragon Fruit, and Pineapple) on your farm, as this can make them larger and their mutations more valuable.

Spotted Deer

A Tier

Can duplicate your berry plants (Celestiberries, Grapes, Strawberries, Blueberries, Cranberries).

Blood Kiwi

A Tier

It can greatly reduce your eggs' hatch time (by 45 seconds per minute), and increase hatch speed by 20%.

Night Owl

A Tier

Has the same ability as Blood Owl, but isnt as good.

Monkey

A Tier

Similar to Silver Monkey, just not as powerful.

Grey Mouse

A Tier

Less effective, but still awesome, version of Brown Mouse.

Giant Ant

A Tier

Not as strong as Red Giant Ant, but still useful.

Squirrel

A Tier

Might drop a free seed of the crop you're planting.

Frog

B Tier

Works like Echo Frog but takes longer to activate its ability.

Dog

B Tier

Its like a low-key version of a Golden Lab.

Cat

B Tier

Pretty much does the same thing as Orange Tabby.

Deer

B Tier

A version of Spotted Deer with lower chances of cloning berry plants.

Hedgehog

B Tier

A less powerful variant of the Blood Hedgehog.

Sea Otter

B Tier

Waters plants at different times to speed up growth, but since most crops grow pretty quickly, it mostly helps when youre short on time or growing slower plants.

Kiwi

B Tier

A weaker version of Blood Kiwi (helps lower hatching time to 20 seconds per minute).

Cow

B Tier

Helps with plant growth.

Turtle

B Tier

Mainly works with sprinklers.

Rooster

B Tier

Only raises egg hatching speed by 20%.

Owl

B Tier

Shares the same abilities as Blood Owl and Night Owl, but it's not that solid.

Chicken

C Tier

Helps a little with egg hatching (boosts speed by 10%).

Black Bunny

C Tier

Boosts carrot sell value by 1.5x, but carrots aren't a top money-maker.

Bunny

C Tier

Just a regular bunny that eats carrots and bumps up their sell value by 1.5x.

Best Pets in Grow a Garden

Most animals in Grow a Garden are super helpful, but a few stand out from the pack:

  • Dragonfly gives you a guaranteed Gold plant every five minutes, raising your crops value around 20 times. If that plant also gets a weather mutation, its value will climb even higher.
  • Praying Mantis is a mythical bug that prays for nearby crops to get a mutation about every 1 minute and 20 seconds. It can also give you Gold plants alongside other plant types.
  • Finally, Raccoon is a solid pet to have in your garden, since it can copy your neighbor's plant and give it to you for free. It can even duplicate Candy Blossom, not to mention Moon Blossom, Moon Mango, and other profitable plants.

Your comment has not been saved

item.title: Nvidia Reports Record Q1 Revenue
item.description:
Summary

  • Nvidia reported record-breaking revenue of $44.1 billion for Q1, up 12% from last quarter and 69% from last year.
  • Despite regulatory setbacks, Nvidia's data center segment generated $39.1 billion, boosting long-term growth confidence.
  • CEO Jensen Huang anticipates a $45 billion revenue in Q2, highlighting strong AI momentum and global partnerships.

Nvidia kicked off its new fiscal year with a huge start, reporting record-breaking revenue for Q1, which wrapped up on April 27, 2025. Nvidia posted a 12% increase in revenue from the previous quarter and a huge 69% jump compared to the same time last year.

Nvidia is known globally for its work in accelerated computing and its graphics processing units that have powered gaming for years. Since starting in 1993, the company has moved well beyond gaming, getting into AI, robotics, and autonomous vehicles. Back in October 2024, Nvidia surpassed Apple to become the most valuable company in the world, reaching a market cap of $3.53 trillion. These latest financial results show that NVIDIA is keeping up that momentum.

For Q1 of fiscal year 2026, Nvidia reported $44.1 billion in revenue. Thats up 12% from last quarter and 69% more than the same quarter a year ago. The growth is mainly thanks to continued global demand for Nvidias AI and data center products, which are playing a key role in building AI infrastructure worldwide. But the quarter wasnt without issues, as in April, new U.S. export rules went into effect that require licenses for shipping Nvidias H20 chips to China - chips that were designed specifically for that market. Because of that, Nvidia took a $4.5 billion charge related to excess H20 inventory and purchase obligations, and couldnt ship another $2.5 billion worth of H20 chips.

Nvidias Data Center Revenue Hits $39.1 Billion

Despite this regulatory setback, Nvidias financial performance remained resilient. The H20 charge lowered margins, with GAAP (Generally Accepted Accounting Principles, the standard accounting rules companies must follow) and non-GAAP gross margins landing at 60.5% and 61.0%. But if that charge is excluded, non-GAAP gross margin would have come in at 71.3%, showing the core business is still going strong. GAAP earnings per share were $0.76, and non-GAAP came in at $0.81. With the H20 impact removed, adjusted EPS hit $0.96. The data center segment continued to lead the way, pulling in $39.1 billion, up 10% from Q4 and 73% year-over-year, helping fuel confidence in the companys long-term growth.

Looking ahead, Nvidia expects second-quarter revenue to reach around $45 billion, even as it factors in about $8 billion in lost H20 revenue due to the ongoing export restrictions. CEO Jensen Huang pointed to strong AI momentum, saying the Blackwell NVL72 AI supercomputer is now in full-scale production and receiving solid demand from cloud providers and system builders. With new AI partnerships in Asia and the Middle East, plus more going on in robotics and gaming, Nvidia is pushing forward on every front. As Huang stated, Countries around the world are recognizing AI as essential infrastructure just like electricity and the internet and Nvidia stands at the center of this profound transformation.
